intro: Terminalia gazensis, commonly known as the Gambia Terminalia, is a deciduous tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, orange-red fruits that are clustered in spherical heads. Its leaves and fruits are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Terminalia gazensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
